answers.text: Hong Taiji's oldest son Hooge and Hong Taiji' half brother Dorgon

context: Hong Taiji died suddenly in <a0_0>September 1643<a0_0/> <a1_0>without a designated heir<a1_0/>. As the Jurchens had traditionally "elected" their leader through a council of nobles, the Qing state did not have in place a clear succession system until the reign of the Kangxi Emperor. The leading contenders for power at this time were <a2_0>Hong Taiji's oldest son Hooge and Hong Taiji' half brother Dorgon<a2_0/>. A compromise candidate in the person of Hong Taiji's five-year-old son, <a3_0>Fulin<a3_0/>, was installed as the Shunzhi Emperor, with Dorgon as regent and de facto leader of the Manchu nation.
